required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pathogenic Mechanisms of Port Wine Stain and Repository of Port Wine Stain Biopsy Samples
clinical_study.official_title: Pathogenic Mechanisms of Port Wine Stain and Repository of Port Wine Stain Biopsy Samples

collaborator.agency: Beckman Laser Institute University of California Irvine

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the pathogenic mechanisms of Port Wine Stain, collect biopsy samples and blood samples to characterize exosomes and metabolites from Port Wine Stain.

detailed_description.textblock: The researcher can detect the defects in nervous system innervation to cutaneous blood vessels contribute to the pathogenesis of Port Wine Stain . Unveiling the pathogenic mechanisms of PWS is crucial to the design of new therapeutic strategies and can use the results to improve current PWS therapeutic outcomes.

primary_outcome.measure: Characterization of Port Wine Stain Birthmark tissue sample

arm_group.description: Biopsy sample from Port Wine Stain Birthmark

intervention.intervention_name: Biopsy sample from Port Wine Stain Birthmark
intervention.description: Biopsy sample from Port Wine Stain Birthmark

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female of all ages.
- Not pregnant.
- Has diagnosis of port wine stain on the arms, legs, chest, bac.
- Ability to understand and carry out subject instructions.
- Subject willing to have skin biopsies on port wine stain and normal skin areas.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women.
- Port Wine Stain on the face.
- History of skin cancer.
- Current participation in an investigational drug evaluation
- Concurrent use of known photosensitizing drugs.

responsible_party.investigator_full_name: Beckman Laser Institute and Medical Center
